title: Is the Casio fx-991ES PLUS calculator allowed in any exam? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes.  There are two type of Scientific Calculator: 1. Standard(Non-Programmable) Scientific Calculator  2. Programmable Scientifc Calculator. Generally Non-Programmable Scientific Calculator are allowed in Engg. and other higher ed. exams.In Casio Scientific Calculator, if model no. ends with P letter in place of S then it is Programmable Calculator. Otherwise it is a Non-Programmable(Standard) Calculator like in Casio fx-991 ES Plus. So, You can use your Casio fx-991ES Plus calculator.  BEST OF LUCK :) P.S.:- link for Casio Standard Calculator - Standard Scientific calculators          link for Casio Programmable Calculator - Programmable calculators

Normally the answer is yes because 991es plus is a non-programable calculator. But to make sure I would suggest you search or inquire to the exam provider on what calculator brands and models are allowed. For example, here in the Philippines the Professional Regulation Commission only recently banned the use of 991ES and 570ES (it's alternative minus the solar panel) and many other non-programable calculators for unknown reasons. What we have is a handful of old models with basic functions.
